edu.rit.numeric

Class Series.RobustStats

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.rit.numeric.Series.RobustStats
  • Enclosing class:
    Series

    public static class Series.RobustStats
extends Object
    Class Series.RobustStats holds the median, mean absolute deviation, and quantiles of a Series.

    If the series is empty, the median, mean absolute deviation, and quantiles are set to Double.NaN (not-a-number), and the histogram bin counts are always 0.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      double meanAbsDev
      Mean absolute deviation of the series' data values.
      double median
      Median of the series' data values, equal to quantile(0.5).

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      int histogram(double lb, double ub)
      Returns the count for the given histogram bin.
      double quantile(double q)
      Returns the given quantile of the series' data values.

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Field Detail

      • median

        public final double median
        Median of the series' data values, equal to quantile(0.5).

      • meanAbsDev

        public final double meanAbsDev
        Mean absolute deviation of the series' data values. The absolute deviation of one value x is |x − median|. The mean absolute deviation is the mean of all the absolute deviations.

    • Method Detail

      • quantile

        public double quantile(double q)
        Returns the given quantile of the series' data values. The q-th quantile is that value x such that a fraction q of the series' data values are less than or equal to x.

        If the series is empty, then Double.NaN (not-a-number) is returned. If q is 0, then Double.NEGATIVE_INFINITY is returned.

        Parameters:
        q - Quantile, 0.0 ≤ q ≤ 1.0.
        Returns:
        The q-th quantile of the series' data values.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - (unchecked exception) Thrown if q is out of range.

      • histogram

        public int histogram(double lb,
            double ub)
        Returns the count for the given histogram bin. This is the number of data values in the series that are greater than or equal to lb and less than ub.
        Parameters:
        lb - Lower bound (inclusive) of histogram bin.
        ub - Upper bound (exclusive) of histogram bin.
        Returns:
        Histogram bin count.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - (unchecked exception) Thrown if lb > ub.
